body.p: My dear Wharton I judge by this time you are in town. the reason that I thought would have deprived me of the pleasure of seeing you is now at an end. my poor Mother, after a long & painful Struggle for life, expired on Sunday morning. when I have seen her buried, I shall come to London, & it will be a particular satisfaction to me to find you there. if you can procure me a tolerable lodging near you, be so good (if you can conveniently) to let me know the night you receive this; if not, I shall go to my old Landlord in Jermyn Street. I believe, I shall come on Tuesday, & stay a few days, for I must return hither to pay my Aunt her Arrears, wch she will demand with great Exactness.

closer.salute:
Adieu, dear Sr, I am
Ever yours,

postscript.p: To me, at Mrs Rogers's of Stoke, near Windsor Bucks.
